Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partly greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, now very worn, and faint traces of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394698) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394698)
